macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Indian Stock Markets Open on Special Sunday Session for Union Budget 2026
items.summary: BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty 50 opened higher on February 1, 2026, with Nifty up 0.05% and Sensex up 0.14% ahead of the Union Budget presentation by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Markets later traded with Nifty at 25,357 (up 36 points) and Sensex at 82,496 (up 227 points) as of 11:05 AM.

items.title: Benchmark Indices Tumble Sharply on Budget Day Special Trading Session
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices fell sharply during the Sunday special trading session on February 1, 2026, with BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points and NSE Nifty 50 dropping below 25,000 amid high volatility ahead of Union Budget 2026.

items.title: Key Stocks to Watch on Budget 2026 Day Including BEL, HAL, L&T
items.summary: Investors focus on defense, infrastructure, and green energy stocks like Bharat Electronics (BEL), HAL, L&T, Hindustan Zinc, and Vedanta during the special Sunday trading session on February 1, 2026, expecting reactions to capital outlay and PLI scheme announcements in the Union Budget.

items.title: Fed Projections Show Divided Views on 2026 Rate Cuts; Dollar Corrects Higher
items.summary: The Fed's December projections indicate a divided committee expecting just one rate cut in 2026, while news of Kevin Warsh's potential nomination to replace Chair Powell triggered a dollar upside correction into early February.

items.title: Australian Dollar Strengthens on Hawkish RBA Comments and Rate Hike Speculation
items.summary: The Australian dollar rose to $0.6965 amid better-than-expected data and hawkish Reserve Bank of Australia remarks, fueling speculation of an early February rate hike after last year's easing cycle.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Enters Bear Market Amid Analyst Divide as Price Recovers to $79,000
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped below $80,000 for the first time since April 2025, bottoming at $77,000 on January 31 before recovering to near $79,000 on February 1. Analysts are split, with some declaring a bear market phase of capitulation and others predicting a climb post-weekend.[1]

items.title: Crypto Markets Weaken with Bitcoin Down 5% as Fed Nominee News Impacts Sentiment
items.summary: Bitcoin trades at around $78,990, down 5% in the past 24 hours, while most large-cap cryptocurrencies also decline amid focus on Federal Reserve nominee dynamics. The broader market shows bearish patterns linked to recent volatility.[2]

items.title: Bitcoin Volatility Tied to Trump’s Federal Reserve Chair Nominee Kevin Warsh
items.summary: Bitcoin's recent price drop is partly attributed to President Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh as Fed chair, which also caused precious metals like silver to plunge. This has fueled forecasts of further BTC declines to $75,000 or even $10,000.[1]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Accelerates Industrial Cyber Threats in OT Environments
items.summary: AI is driving faster phishing, exploit creation, and sophisticated malware in industrial systems, lowering barriers for complex OT attacks while enabling evasion and data exfiltration. Experts recommend AI-powered continuous detection and gray-zone response strategies.

items.title: University at Albany Reveals Stratified Geometry in AI Agent Learning
items.summary: Researchers discovered that AI systems, including transformer-based models, organize internal representations in stratified geometric spaces rather than smooth manifolds, offering new insights into decision-making and potential for adaptive training.

items.title: New Study Evaluates LLMs on Creativity, Accuracy, and Explanations Using NLP Metrics
items.summary: An analysis of LLMs like ChatGPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek found minimal performance differences, with ChatGPT slightly ahead in lexical diversity, semantic similarity, sentiment, and grammar across creative and technical tasks.
items.source: ICCK Transactions on Emerging Topics in Artificial Intelligence

items.title: AI Transforming Audit Processes with Agentic Capabilities and Continuous Monitoring
items.summary: New AI tools automate audit tasks like anomaly detection and fraud identification in real-time, with firms preparing for agentic AI to revolutionize workflows while emphasizing human oversight.

items.title: Research Highlights Calibration Improvements in ML Classifiers Using KL Divergence
items.summary: A study introduces Local Calibration Score and KL-based tuning for better probabilistic predictions in binary classifiers like Random Forest and XGBoost, outperforming traditional metrics in high-stakes domains.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Women in Games Launches 2026 Manifesto to Address Gender Imbalance
items.summary: Women in Games released its 2026 Manifesto, calling for systemic changes to empower women in the gaming industry across industry, education, policy, community, and culture spheres. It highlights that women represent nearly half of players but less than a third of the workforce, positioning equality as essential for innovation and sustainability.

items.title: GDC 2026 State of the Game Industry Survey Reveals High Union Support and Layoffs
items.summary: The GDC's 2026 survey shows 82% of US developers support unionization, with one in four respondents laid off in the last two years. It underscores ongoing industry challenges amid calls for better worker protections.

items.title: Regulating the Game Global Awards Announces Finalists for Inaugural Event
items.summary: Regulating the Game revealed finalists for its first Global Awards following strong interest and nominations. The awards focus on regulatory aspects of the gaming industry.

items.title: February 2026 Packed with Major Game Releases Including Yakuza Kiwami 3 and Dragon Quest VII
items.summary: Upcoming titles like Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (Feb 12), Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Feb 5), High On Life 2 (Feb 13), and others such as Nioh 3 and Ys X: Proud Nordics are highlighted in multiple previews. February features a diverse lineup across platforms including PS5, Xbox, Switch 2, and PC.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
